The “YouTube Stream” content source is used to display a full stream of videos from a channel/playlist.
If you want to display a single youtube video, please select the content source “Default Slider” and add a video layer in the slide editor.

Minimal Height of Slider (Optional) FullScreen Align Force Layers align within the full slider instead of the layer grid. The minimum height of the Slider in FullScreen mode. Disable Force FullWidth Disable the FullWidth Force function, and allow to float the Fullheight slider horizontal. Increase/Decrease Fullscreen Height (Optional) Example: #header or .header, .footer, #somecontainer | Height of Slider will be decreased with the height of these Containers to fit perfect in the screen. Decrease/Increase height of Slider. Can be used with px and %. Positive/Negative values allowed. Example: 40px or 10%
Overflow Hidden
Adds overflow:hidden to the slider wrapping container which will hide / cut any overlapping elements. Mostly used in Carousel Sliders. Respect Aspect Ratio
It will keep aspect ratio and ignore max height of Layer Grid by upscaling. Layer Area will be vertical centered. The minimum height of the Slider in FullWidth or Auto mode. The maximum width of the Slider in Auto mode.

      Standard Embeding
      For the pages or posts editor insert the shortcode:
      From the widgets panel drag the "Revolution Slider" widget to the desired sidebar
      Advanced Embeding
      From the theme html use: <?php putRevSlider( 'alias' ); ?>
      To add the slider only to homepage use: <?php putRevSlider('"slider1"', 'homepage'); ?>
      To add the slider on specific pages or posts use: <?php putRevSlider('"slider1"', '2,10'); ?>

      View Plugin Permission:
      The role of user that can view and edit the plugin
      Include RevSlider libraries globally:
      ON - Add CSS and JS Files to all pages.
      Off - CSS and JS Files will be only loaded on Pages where any rev_slider shortcode exists.
      Pages to include RevSlider libraries:
      Specify the page id's that the front end includes will be included in. Example: 2,3,5 also: homepage,3,4
      Insert JavaScript Into Footer:
      Putting the js to footer (instead of the head) is good for fixing some javascript conflicts.
      Defer JavaScript Loading:
      Defer the loading of the JavaScript libraries to maximize page loading speed.
      Load all JavaScript libraries:
      Enabling this will load all JavaScript libraries of Slider Revolution. Disabling this will let Slider Revolution load only the libraries needed for the current Sliders on page. Enabling this option can solve CDN issues.
      Enable Markup Export option:
      This will enable the option to export the Slider Markups to copy/paste it directly into websites.
      Font Loading URL:
      Insert something in it and it will be used instead of http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family= (For example: http://fonts.useso.com/css?family= which will also work for chinese visitors)
      Default Settings for Advanced Responsive Grid Sizes:
      Desktop Grid Width
      Notebook Grid Width
      Tablet Grid Width
      Mobile Grid Width
      Define the default Grid Sizes for devices: Desktop, Tablet and Mobile
      Slide Stage Collapse:
      Collapse left WordPress Menu on Slide Stage automatically
      Enable Notifications:
      Enable/Disable ThemePunch Notifications in the Admin Notice bar.
      Enable Logs:
      Enable console logs for debugging.
      Enable Missing Activation Area:
      Force the Activation Area to show up if the Theme disabled it.
      Enable Blank Page Creation for Slider Packages:
      Enable option to automatically create a Blank Page if a Slider Pack is installed.
      Enable Blank Page Creation for Single Sliders:
      Enable option to automatically create a Blank Page if a Single Slider is installed.
      Run Slider Revolution database creation: Go!
      Force creation of Slider Revolution database structure to fix table issues that may occur for example at the Slider creation process.
